alert.note: Alert for Charlotte; DeSoto; Hardee; Highlands; Lee; Manatee; Sarasota (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 28 at 5:52PM EDT until September 28 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tampa Bay Ruskin has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Hardee County in central Florida... DeSoto County in south central Florida... Southwestern Highlands County in south central Florida... Charlotte County in southwestern Florida... Northern Lee County in southwestern Florida... Eastern Manatee County in west central Florida... Sarasota County in west central Florida... * Until 900 PM EDT. * At 552 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain associated with Hurricane Ian is producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 5 and 16 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 3 to 6 inches are possible in the warned area through 9 PM. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by Hurricane Ian. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cape Coral, North Port, Sarasota, Bradenton, Punta Gorda, Arcadia, Wauchula, Port Charlotte, Southeast Arcadia, Myakka City, Charlotte County Airport, Myakka River State Park, Babcock Webb Wma, Babcock Ranch, Ona, Lake Sarasota, Lakewood Ranch, Sarasota Springs, South Gate Ridge and Gulf Gate Estates. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Charlotte; DeSoto; Hardee; Highlands; Lee; Manatee; Sarasota
